website_summaries.verdict: If you are paying for the fastest internet offered by your cable provider, this cable modem-router combo will ensure your Wi-Fi network is making the most of it.
pros: Compatible with all major cable providers
Simple to manage via mobile app
cons: For some reason, this model does not feature a USB port

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE THIS PRODUCT IF YOU PLAN ON CUTTING CABLE!
customer_reviews.text: This device does not support wifi streaming. I conducted 2 speed tests with this device: 1. WIRED - via Ethernet directly to the modem, my download speed was 286 mbs (I pay for 250 mbs) 2. WIRELESSLY - TWO FEET AWAY from the same modem my download speed dropped to 80 mbs!!! I returned it to Amazon today and replaced it with a Motorola MB8600 modem and an Eero mesh network and my wireless connectivity = 255 mbs!
customer_reviews.author: Robert C. Cochran

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase
customer_reviews.text: Purchased new and received a refurbished still attached to someone’s account
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Sweetser

customer_reviews.title: Received New Defective Unit
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this modem to replace an existing Arris unit I have had for many years. Setup was fast and easy, however there were connectivity issues from the start. After Xfinity tech support suggested that the new modem was the cause, I tried the old modem just to see, and the problem was solved. This is not worth $300 if the quality control allows a half-baked unit to be sold.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Admin services are only possible with a hard wired lan cable.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to upgrade my home wifi. Setup is almost impossible, the android app to manage the hardware is useless. Arris tech support admitted that the software doesn't work, had no idea if it would be fixed, and told me not to use it. The only way to get administrative services is to hard wire (lan) a desktop computer to the modem. I purchased a Netlink 3.1 modem which set up easily and seems to work ok. I am returning the Arris to Amazon for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great product once it is installed.
customer_reviews.text: Has never lost the Comcast cable feed. Wifi is rock solid and fast. Waited for months for this wifi cable modem to come out. Difficult to install wifi.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Zee

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy this router modem.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this when we upgraded our xFinity service to 600mbps internet. It hooked up and connected great. I noticed after multiple speed tests in various locations of my home and through the wired Ethernet device, the speed on any device was never more than 55mbps. We couldn’t stream a show, it took forever to download a spreadsheet as I work from home. I tried numerous fixes and nothing improved. Also, the app is terrible. There is minimal controls of devices. I went back to paying $13 a month from xfinity for their device to keep using xFi.
customer_reviews.author: Emily's mom

customer_reviews.title: NOT COMPATIBLE WITH SPECTRUM
customer_reviews.text: I have wasted over 4 hours going back and forth from arris support to spectrum and back again and even had a tech come out. It is NOT compatible with Spectrum's equipment. They advertise as Spectrum compatible which is a blatant falsehood. This whole thing was a waste of my time on a Sunday afternoon, and now I don't trust the tech mags online reviews since they also state this version is compatible. While it may be in the future, as of this date, in this area (NYC) it is NOT COMPATIBLE WITH SPECTRUMS EQUIPTMENT. Next time Netgear or Motorola. They just lost a customer for good. So angry I've wasted the entire day
customer_reviews.author: Anmian

customer_reviews.title: UTTER JUNK
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: while the speed improved, it took a little less than 2 months for the quality to completely deteriorate. it constantly drops wifi connection and when it eventually connects, it's very slow. i should have heeded the warning from the reviews that this would happen. If I could return it I would. Attached is the speed for a 285mbps Comcast xfinity plan. It hit 286mbps after installation then everything went downhill from there. greatly improved speed of my internet connection from comcast. i pay for 285mbps and had my PS4, roku connected to it. PS4 consistently gets 260mbps with wired connection.
customer_reviews.author: Andy ray

customer_reviews.title: one month, still working :)
customer_reviews.text: works good, and, despite the seller reply, everyone can see system time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE THIS PRODUCT.  All but useless
customer_reviews.text: The least configurable modem I've ever owned. Wifi works great but I don't want or need ipv6 on my LAN or another DHCP server or no way to configure it remotely. Can forward ports but going back to see what's forward shows nothing until you add a new entry and then the rest will show up. Totally worthless considering the price. No remote management and even if you configure port forwarding it looses the information every reboot. DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT IF YOU LIKE TO CONTROL YOUR OWN NETWORK SETTINGS.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Lane

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing
customer_reviews.text: Wow....is all I can say about this modem/router. I had a previous model Arris Surfboard modem and the WiFi reach seemed subpar at best (necessitating 2 Range Extenders). I just installed and added this model, however, to our Xfinity service and I can say that I am blown away by both the speed and range of this router/modem's network. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: S. Trahan

customer_reviews.title: Good product- no complaints!
customer_reviews.text: I've only had it a few days but I found it quite simple to install, has good range and works as advertised... Just as it should! (no calls to tech support required for me)
customer_reviews.author: GENE P WHIT

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I do t know if the modem is defective or if it is bad programming. The wireless connection is dropped all the time. There is never consistant speeds. If you do speed tests you will get 2 megs per second then then very next time seconds later you will get 250 megs per second. Every test is very different. The modem has to be reset every couple of days because it just loses signal all together even on wired devices. It's got problems.
customer_reviews.author: Whetman

customer_reviews.title: Advertised as designed to replace Comcast rental Modem
customer_reviews.text: Worked with Arris tech support for several hours to get this modem to connect/work with Comcast. They finally gave up and told me to return the unit. It might have just been a lemon unit but I decided to just go back to renting from Comcast.
customer_reviews.author: Gerry Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Worth the install
customer_reviews.text: It's working great! It's not plug and play, and took a bit of technical gymnastics to get this up and running and activated. Simple and easy connections for out of the box setup. Getting it to work with Xfinity was mildly complicated. I wound up using the app as the direct connect to the internet PC method wouldn't talk with Xfinity to activate. Once that part is done the rest works pretty good. I'm glad I have a future proof modem and I'm saving the rental cost each month. Mine was $14/month rental.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Z

customer_reviews.title: Support
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this for about 2 weeks. When I first hooked it up it kept saying the past was incorrect. Finally it let me login. Support is AWFUL. They want you to pay to get any answers even for the first time using it. No real way to see if the issue is the modem or your internet connection. Since Arris is no help and unfortunately neither was Atlantic Broadband except when I called to re-activate their modem.
customer_reviews.author: Nanny0758

customer_reviews.title: Very Surprised the level of quality for the money....
customer_reviews.text: Had it in service for 45 days...never a great signal (especially for $300) in a 1000sf apt. Customer Service was "fair" not great....language hurdle was a huge. Amazon would not refund due to outside 30 day window. I have to sell the replacement unit (when it arrives) on the secondary market. Not Pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Merrill

customer_reviews.title: Made my surfing experience much faster
customer_reviews.text: Comcast notified me that my router was out of date and was not upgradeable so I bought this and I can't believe how much faster my speeds are on my computer because my other router was not giving me full download speeds so if your computer is running a little slow I suggest you upgrade I'd buy my routers so I don't have to pay that monthly fee.
customer_reviews.author: Jurgen H Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Best coverage and solid performance
customer_reviews.text: I have tried almost all Netgear modem and routers and my latest one was NETGEAR Nighthawk AX6 6, and all failed to give a good coverage or stay connected in 2700 sq home. i liked Netgear app and power on/off buttons and blocking kids. but its so annoying that keeps dropping devices off. once I switched to Arris SB8300, it has better coverage and not a single device drops yet. Arrris is so simple and solid don't get deceived by number of antennas and led lights that other router/modem has.
customer_reviews.author: Fadi Ghattas

customer_reviews.title: Fast wired, WiFi is Trash
customer_reviews.text: I get the speeds i expect from the wired connection. However, the wifi is awful. The internet connection via wifi drops constantly. I can't for the life of me connect to my printer on a bridged router. The app works half the time and it does this thing were it says your stored password is incorrect. Only way to resolve is uninstall and reinstall. I've had to do this 6 times in as many months. I've very upset with the quality of this very expensive modem.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.....
customer_reviews.text: I am glad I finally purchased my own modem and stopped paying $11.00 a month to my cable company for a rental. What a rip off. I wonder how many people don't realize they are throwing money away each month. Easy setup and with the tech help people at the cable company the switch was smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Webwar

customer_reviews.title: Works great and not a china company
customer_reviews.text: No issues with it and I like the features. No complaints and I like that its not a chinese company like most other routers. I'm trying to avoid china when it comes to security especially
customer_reviews.author: J R

customer_reviews.title: This is works like a dream
customer_reviews.text: I have no problems in the 2 weeks of ownership if an inconsistent signal. Wi-fi is strong at all points of my home, though my condo isn't very big. I would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jason G. Snow

customer_reviews.title: NOT I repeat, NOT an Approved Modem By Spectrum for ANY speed.
customer_reviews.text: After spending over 2 hours on the phone with Spectrum Tech Support they were not able to get modem up to their Ultra Speed plan 400+Mbps. As it turn out this Modem is NOT on Spectrum list of approved Modems for any speed. Make sure you check Spectrum's site for their list of approved modem and not a sellers site or claims by the manufacturer and save yourself hours of headaches. Save yourself time and go to a Spectrum office and get their Modem for free and buy yourself a good router as Spectrum's Modems do not have a router in them.
customer_reviews.author: Vanaj

customer_reviews.title: Did not work out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Spent 45 mins with cable Co after hours support trying to get it to work to not avail. Cable tech showed up at house next day and could not get to work. He installed their version of similar device and was up and running within minutes. A real PITA to have to burn day waiting for tech... So lesson here is it either works or it doesn't. Don't waste time trying to trouble shoot. Either get another one or rent from Cable Co.
customer_reviews.author: TW

customer_reviews.title: This thing is garbage
customer_reviews.text: Im so absolutely furious with this thing and now I cant return it. Its impossible to add an extender or other devices to it and once you do add devices sometimes they work sometimes they dont. The app for the phone doesnt work either it wont connect to the device so the app on the computer is the only option and once you forget your password, there is no way to retrieve it. Its hard to navigate the website also, no ease of use here oh how I miss my old Linksys modem sigh.
customer_reviews.author: C. Green

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Performance
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded (for less than I was paying prior) to full 1000 Mbps and needed a new modem/router to handle the additional bandwidth. I was a little worried about the modem and router being in one unit, but that's not an issue at all. The router is not in an ideal position within the house, but we get an excellent signal throughout our 3500 sq ft two story home. It was no problem using the app and online interface to get it set up. The only issue (and this is not the product's fault at all) was getting the Xfinity customer service to activate it after installation. I am super happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: BobMac

customer_reviews.title: Has not worked since receiving
customer_reviews.text: This unit has not worked since receiving it, but was not discovered as the issue until last week (our provider assumed it was there equipment leading to the unit). Going to return and receive that its past the return window and out almost $300. I expect a unit like this to be fully operational for that price or offer a longer return period.
customer_reviews.author: Krystal T.

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Purchased new one but received a refurbished one still tied to someone else’s account! On the cable network. WiFi signal drops significantly when you move away from the unit! After one month the WiFi constantly goes in and out of service. Will have to buy another new one with another brand. This one is junk and not working!! Poor quality!
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Initial Setup Tough but Now Works Well
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to save the high monthly Comcast charge for their Gateway modem/router unit, so I went on their web site to see what was compatible. It was very hard to find the right web page. Their website said only this unit, so I bought one. Arris CS was not helpful, but Comcast helped set it up. It'll take about 15 months to amortized the cost. Will I stay with Comcast that long, I wonder?!
customer_reviews.author: PFJohns

customer_reviews.title: Weak transmission range and NO support
customer_reviews.text: This thing has a terrible transmission range and just as disappointing is not compatible with all home WiFi connected devices. My cable company modem was awesome. We live on a 1/2 acre and could get a signal everywhere. Now with this Arris we can barely get a signal in my garage. Just as bad it only worked on about half of our WiFi connected home devices. On top of that their APP manager doesn't work and neither does the On-Line link, so there is no way to adjust Security settings. Stay away from this one!
customer_reviews.author: Forrest G.

customer_reviews.title: Useless Product
customer_reviews.text: The product failed to sustain. It worked two days and I looked at Amazon and could not find the return date, but the return date is over and I have no use with this lemon. Please refund and I do not trust this product. This is the second time I got a useless product. Infinity internet provider recommended to use another modem + wireless router.
customer_reviews.author: GeorgePottanat

customer_reviews.title: Modem part yes, router part, mixed results
customer_reviews.text: The modem works great and was super easy to set up. I called my cable company and they help me get it set up. The router does not work well with my iMac but works fine with everything else, hence the mixed results. Since I do a lot of work on my iMac, I was very disappointed with the router for WiFi. I ended up plugging my old router into the new modem and my problems went away. It was very difficult to find a modem that worked with my cable provider, RCN.
customer_reviews.author: Mothers son

customer_reviews.title: Works but You will Likely Need to Contact Cox Communications for Activation
customer_reviews.text: Works as per description, but if when you first try to install - it does not work. Don't waste your time and call Cox Communications Tech Support to help activate. This is one of the Modems/routers included in their approved list on their website, but for most of us - they will need to help you activate so reach out to them prior to wasting time like we did trying to do it ourselves - it should have been a simple activation, but nothing is simple with Cox Communications.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: Not sure
customer_reviews.text: We’re at about three months with this router/modem and have mixed feelings. It does keep a connection at all times unlike our prior TPS-link modem which I’d have to restart about once a week...BUT WiFi has been spotty. We’re 2700 square feet and have full house coverage with this BUT it’s just spotty at times and the WiFi extenders we’re not only super difficult to connect but are now all but useless (despite being connected to the modem - they apparently can’t connect to the internet).
customer_reviews.author: Honest Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Fixed my issues!
customer_reviews.text: This worked like a charm! I kept getting dropped from Wifi, never happens now!
customer_reviews.author: Shel

customer_reviews.title: The absolute worst. Don't buy.
customer_reviews.text: Customer Service is a joke. The equipment has horrible signal--we have a small house, one floor, and it was awful. I could never sign into the gateway page to set up reserved IP addresses--Customer Service kept telling me to factory reset the router. After three times, they couldn't give me an answer. The app doesn't connect and doesn't allow you to set up parental controls. Worthless. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Leanne B.

customer_reviews.title: Invest a little more if you need reliable network.
customer_reviews.text: I had 1gbs from my internet provider. The modem works well and I was getting 980 DL on Ethernet. On WiFi though I got 240 mbps with very very short range. Unstable WiFi network kept dropping on me as well. The WiFi just goes offline for couple of minutes then comes back up. Would not recommend it nor I’m going to buy anything from them again. I switched to eero mesh WiFi with Netgear modem, this junky device helped me justify the cost.
customer_reviews.author: AA

customer_reviews.title: Wireless Printer hook up
customer_reviews.text: This was by far the easiest electronic I have ever installed. It was so easy and all of my WiFi electronics hooked up no problem, except my wireless HP Printer. It took me all day to figure out I couldn't hook it up to the guest log in, even if my computer was hooked up to the guest. My main account wasn't listed in the printers choices. The WiFi that worked for the printer is the model number of the router. Once I hooked it up to the WiFi with the model number of the Arris, and hooked up computer up to it as well, everything worked. No pauses, disconnects. It is great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WiFi signal
customer_reviews.text: Should have checked the reviews before buying this product! Has a lot of connectivity issues I thought it was the internet however it wasn't I tried a friend's router and worked fine. however this how kept disconnecting from the Wifi. you can check the ARRIS website there are a lot of unhappy costumers complaining about the same issue. Isnt cheap for having this issues. :(
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Great Item, Easy Install, Well Worth It
customer_reviews.text: This modem was an easy install and has a very intuitive user interface. Comcast/Xfinity internet service provider. Once hooked up, ISP automatically recognized the new equipment and did all the initial setup. Definitely worth the $.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 2

customer_reviews.title: Power cycles at least once an hour
customer_reviews.text: This Arris modem power cycles and crashed about every hour after Comcast activation! It just stayed on enough for Amazon folks to certified it as Refurbished! I suspect this is the reason the original owner dumped this unit too! I believe there are firmware issues w the Modem but I don’t have time to chase it. I plan to stay away from Amazon Refurnished electronic gear too.
customer_reviews.author: David Mortaz

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this product
customer_reviews.text: Should have stayed with Cox Modem. This product is pathetic, WiFi signal is weak within 10 ft. Do not buy it. Needs to be wired. Completely dissatisfied and I’m stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works with RCN
customer_reviews.text: I didn't buy this "new", and so I was ready to send it back if it didn't work. To my surprise, with a little Googling - it all worked well. You have to be a subscriber to the FASTER speeds in order to utilize this DOCSIS 3.1 modem. After your ISP provisions the modem, it is easy to define the SSID and passwords for this model. Just be sure and plug in the ethernet cord in order to connect with the modem's configuration page 192.168.0.1.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Have to reboot about once a week.
customer_reviews.text: Most of the time this operates very good but about once a week or so you loose the internet connection. This requires you to reboot the modem. I unplug it for 10 seconds rather than use the reset button since that will reset everything including passwords to factory default. It then takes somewhere around ten minutes for it to fully reboot and provide an internet connection. I have not actually timed it ten minutes is just an estimate. The time it takes to boot up seems excessive and is annoying. The need to reboot and wait so long to be able to use it is why I only give 3 out of 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Customer service will not help. And if you port forward it will intercept all communication into your public facing IP. You will have to use a different network just to access the forwarded ports (Ex. if you use a domain name, or run a game server). Live chat ignored me completely. Phone support tried to explain simple networking terms instead of actually helping. I'm a network+ certified tech, and this is not how networking should work. Save yourself the headache. Do NOT buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Tara Piccari

customer_reviews.title: Pumped up my network performance!
customer_reviews.text: Arris install fired up my network performance in speed and consistency. Love the performance.
customer_reviews.author: Francis Villa

customer_reviews.title: Terrible reliability
customer_reviews.text: Constantly loses the network or the wifi just stops. Takes forever to restart as well. Has been unreliable for over a week, and I found that many other people have had similar issues with this same model.
customer_reviews.author: ChristW

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Disregard all negative posts by inept users. This thing couldn't be easier to set up if you just wait a few minutes and let it stabilize all the incoming data at setup. Up and running fully customized in 20 minutes. Blazing fast speed. Never reviewed an item on here, but this one warrants it to balance out all the other negativity. And I bought a used one!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cost Savings!!!
customer_reviews.text: Provider charges $15 a month to "rent" their router/modem!! At $15 a month, a $300 device pays for itself in less than two years. Why pay that FOREVER when you can buy your own and cut that cost. It took less than 15 mins to set up.
customer_reviews.author: GWC

customer_reviews.title: You need to rest it after 3 to 5 days.
customer_reviews.text: The modem works fine most of the time. The issue comes when suddenly your skype call start to cut or when you lose connection intermittently on your game . Reset and done, the issue is gone. Now, this is annoying, this shouldn't happen. I had respect for the brand, now I have my questions. My issue is not unique, please search this issue and you will see that a lot of people are struggling with it. I have 1GB Xfinity service. FYR.
customer_reviews.author: Marcos

customer_reviews.title: easy to use and activate with Xfinity. But.
customer_reviews.text: It works great, was easy to set up, both the standard signal and the 5G signal work amazingly. But for whatever reason, the seller slapped the shipping label directly onto the retail box. It wasn't inside an Amazon box or anything, And the delivery driver just left it directly on my porch for all passing by my house to see. Luckily it didn't get stolen.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Criswell

customer_reviews.title: Intel Chip Defect - Stay Away
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy this router. It has latency issues and disconnects often. It’s not your internet company but this router. It has a intel chip inside and all intel router chips have defects. Google it. Going with a Netgear CM1200 in combo with google nest WiFi mesh.
customer_reviews.author: Usman

customer_reviews.title: 24hours DIED, per ARRIS SUPPORT
customer_reviews.text: In less than 24 hours, WiFi died, then Hardwire. Unit could be seen from ISP. Called Arris support, did a Factory reset. Returned BRICKED unit to Amazon and will try a 2nd.
customer_reviews.author: MIkeH

customer_reviews.title: Good signal inside the entire house
customer_reviews.text: Arris surfboard 3.1 works great, was connecting right away and I have had no dropouts or lag when gaming. Only bad thing is that my satellite losses signal once a day, I have to reboot router for it to return. Only happens to direct tv cable, phone WiFi still works when I loose the signal so it must the cable company. Besides that I’m satisfied
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great. The WOW guy came in and set up my service and incorporated this modem router combo and it works perfectly. I live in a condo with a basement and two upstairs bedrooms and the wifi signal hits both up and downstairs. Not to mention, how fast my internet speeds are I really can't complain so 5 stars it is.
customer_reviews.author: Why?

customer_reviews.title: It works great
customer_reviews.text: After reading some opinions about this unit I was nervous if it will give us trouble installing. Nope. It was quite easy . The aid all works good. We were surprise how far the WiFi range changed After we upgraded to this unit. No issues with connection or switching itself off for no reason.
customer_reviews.author: C.Kupczynski

customer_reviews.title: Did not work, not as pictured on  site
customer_reviews.text: Did not work, not as pictured on site. Very low quality. Wrong code sent for return and then UPS would not send.
customer_reviews.author: DJANLEL

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of coverage for 2,000 sq foot house
customer_reviews.text: I have this installed in a cabinet inside a closet and the wifi signal is great throughout my 2,000 sq foot house. This unit offers more than I need as far as speed and wifi signal strength.
customer_reviews.author: Brewer

customer_reviews.title: Been using for months with only a few issues
customer_reviews.text: The wifi went down a couple times over the course of multiple months, and that's somewhat normal/acceptable from my point of view. This is a good combo, although it took our internet provider a little time to get it to work correctly with it. They had to give us a free plan upgrade before it worked.
customer_reviews.author: Varun

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Router modem combo.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased Arris modems for the past 15 years and find that the quality to be great, signal strength better than expected, ease of setup second to none. You want regret purchasing this router, modem combo .
customer_reviews.author: Nolaninc

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY WITH XFINITY
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Arris router and I don't know if the company is bad, but it seems that this product drops connection frequently. I will say that the gigabit ethernet speeds are AMAZING, but playing games or on calls with drop for a second and it really messes you up when you need precision. I believe that it has to do with the internet service provider (isp/Xfinity) and the fact that the small box tries to make FOUR networks, two for main and two for guests.
customer_reviews.author: Elena

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: Connection drops multiple times during the day. Only way to get back to internet is to unplug and plug back in. What a waste of money? W-fi range is also very limited.
customer_reviews.author: S. Prasad

customer_reviews.title: Arris Modem Is Actually A Paperweight
customer_reviews.text: First shipment got LOST in the system(next day delivery was promised). After 5 days I finally received the replacement. Nine days of troubleshooting followed with Arris and internet provider. Arris finally advised me the product was defective and gave me a case number to return it. DON’T waste your time with this inferior product. This is no router modem, THIS is a paperweight. Not only will I NEVER buy another BS Arris product, but if I ever have another experience like this with Amazon, I will delete the app and never order from them again.
customer_reviews.author: SGBH

customer_reviews.title: Spectrum
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine with Spectrum. Be sure to have nothing wired or wireless connected to this device otherwise you can run in MAC address issues. Applies to any Gateway. Called Spectrum, after about 10-15 minutes Gateway was working great. Didn't like the price at all.
customer_reviews.author: btc909

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: XFinity misled me to think that just having this modem would give me gigabit speed. Not true. Need fiber optic line and updated coax cable to get the speed. This is a great device, just didn't work on my Xfinity system for the speed I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Alex C.

customer_reviews.title: Device drops connections, resets randomly - Doesn't record events in logs.
customer_reviews.text: It's been dropping out the WiFi several times a day. Firmware is up to date, but it records "attacks" without showing any information on them. Trying to save the logs records even LESS information then it doesn't save. DO NOT PURCHASE!
customer_reviews.author: BMaryott

customer_reviews.title: No More Modem Fees
customer_reviews.text: Using this for 1 Gigabyte (1000mbps) of high speed internet from Xfinity. I was tired of paying the extra $10-15 for the modem fee every month from Xfinity. It's alot upfront but it'll pay for itself and save a lot of money in years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley George

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the cost!
customer_reviews.text: Great device and packaged well! Didn’t come in an Amazon box, instead it was in the original box with a shipping label on it, I would have liked to see it in an Amazon box with additional protection but the device works.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Modem good, Comcast bad
customer_reviews.text: Modem is ok, its Comcast that I loath. Lots of brief interruptions in service and often much slower than promised, despite comcast speed test
customer_reviews.author: peter meyers

customer_reviews.title: WORST experience
customer_reviews.text: This modem stopped working, conveniently 14 days after the return deadline. I have called, messaged and emailed ARRIS customer support to replace this modem under the warranty provided. I have received NO help. This is quite possibly the worst experience I have had with an amazon retailer. Won't use again.
customer_reviews.author: Megan K

customer_reviews.title: Might not work with Cox if you have wireless receivers
customer_reviews.text: Modem is great puts out good signal and is fast. Drawback to Cox customers is that if you have the wireless 4K cable tv receivers they will NOT connect to this modem.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Admin function inoperable
customer_reviews.text: It is impossible to login to the web GUI to use administrative functions - after I’ve logged in, the interface tells me to login again, then tells me that another user has already logged in. Admin function simply doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.author: K. Coen

customer_reviews.title: Wi-Fi Drops
customer_reviews.text: I've had the device for less than two weeks and have experienced several Wi-Fi signal drops. I got the device to replace the Comcast router, but haven't seen an improvement in performance on the Wi-Fi. I have seen a slight increase in speed, but the drops are annoying.
customer_reviews.author: James Arthurs

customer_reviews.title: Wifi is very poor
customer_reviews.text: For the price, the wifi is very unsatisfactory, cuts in and out.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: It's meh.
customer_reviews.text: Really short wifi signal for both 2.4 and 5 hrtz. No way to limit data or disconect someone off your network.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: Spotty at best. Drops off quite a bit and has to be reset a lot. Thus happened while on vacation, modem went off line and lost cameras and home alarm system. Arris is of no help with tech support. For the $300 I spent I would have expected better reliability. Better to look for the 8200 as it is cheaper and vert similar to the 8300. Very dissapointed in the reliability of the SBG8300.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph

customer_reviews.title: Reliability of the product.
customer_reviews.text: Had to call my internet provider and Arris support numerous times for troubleshooting. After 4 months of usage, more than 10 calls to support, this product failed miserably. Arris was kind enough to replaced it within a week (they waited to received my defective one before shipping the replacement).
customer_reviews.author: Jack Friday

customer_reviews.title: No 2.4Ghz band
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product in April and have only had a 5Ghz band ever since. That means that I can't connect any of my smart home products to the wifi, no Sonos speakers, no Fitbit scale, not Levoit air purifier, nothing. DO NOT GET THIS PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: mfciers

customer_reviews.title: Essy set up.
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up.....THANKFULLY. I was word give it I'm not very Tech savvy.
customer_reviews.author: carla thomas

customer_reviews.title: Cannot update firmware
customer_reviews.text: Why????? Why can't I update the firmware? Relying on Comcast to do that???
customer_reviews.author: binbinbin

customer_reviews.title: Modem great, WIFI terrible
customer_reviews.text: Hey all! After install, seemed to work fine, after about six devices connected, consistent intermittent drops and disconnects across all devices. Devices were NOT saturating bandwidth.. tried both 5Ghz, and 2.4Ghz... Both equally unstable. I am returning this... in the meantime picked up an Asus router, along with Motorola cable modem, 100% stable, more WiFi options, and better range.
customer_reviews.author: David Foerster

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: Hooked up had to call comcast to get it activated, but works great.
customer_reviews.author: R. Worsham

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this modem just a few months ago as it specified it was compatible with Spectrum's service. It worked well for a little while and now Spectrum is stating that this modem does not support their signal and that they've received the same complaints from other customers that have the same modem. I was also very unhappy with their tech support as they were not able to assist us on helping troubleshoot. Do not waist your money or time on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Rubio

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY THIS - DIAL UP IS FASTER!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have had nothing but problems with this since installation. It's terrible. I've spent a total of 25 hours, between my ISP and Arris tech support, trying to get this thing to work. Wifi is terrible. Interface via app is terrible. Can't wait to get rid of this thing. Awful.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Croft

customer_reviews.title: A most excellent Modem.Router
customer_reviews.text: Was very easy to set up and configure. Performance seems to be excellent so far. Time will tell. This was chosen for its features and other reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Bill V

customer_reviews.title: Very weak wifi signal
customer_reviews.text: While I'm happy with the speed the wireless signal is far less than my old modem/router. Very very disappointing. I've had to also buy two signal extenders just to get back to where I was. They are 2.4 so 5G is quite limited to the main central part of my house near the router.
customer_reviews.author: Philip G.

customer_reviews.title: Be ready to restart every couple days.
customer_reviews.text: This is not a good product. It goes crazy every few days. Restart and maybe your credentials will work. Returning and getting a different one. Signal is good when it works.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, easy to setup, easy to manage, great security.
customer_reviews.author: Lester

customer_reviews.title: ARRIS JUNK
customer_reviews.text: GARBAGE. TECH SUPPORT SUCKS! RETURNING, WASTED ENTIRE DAY GOT NO WHERE..
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: As with do many products, time will tell. The all in one (modem and router) is a no brainier, thereby saving rental monthly fees with the provider. The device will pay for itself in nine months with a significant upgrade in performance. Installation wouldn't challenge a child. I've reserved the last star for future months of excellent service.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa GL

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY FOR RCN!!!
customer_reviews.text: The modem fits.all the requirements for RCN internet, but we spent over an hour on the phone with a technician and not once did they see the modem available to connect on their end. We did all the troubleshooting tricks and it never connected. Our previous modem was connected before and after testing this one. Check with your ISP on this specific model before buying! And if they're not sure, don't buy this..
customer_reviews.author: Tony Rizzo

customer_reviews.title: No gig speed after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: About 2 months after purchasing this it has gone from gigabit internet speed to 500-700 mbps, that's with an ethernet cord.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew M.

customer_reviews.title: Weak signal for price
customer_reviews.text: Wifi signal is to weak to go from my office to the living room almost directly above the router on the floor right above the router.
customer_reviews.author: Branden Lane

customer_reviews.title: Bad WIFI
customer_reviews.text: 2 Units both WIFI issues from DAY ONE! Garbage for WIFI, brand new and lose connection every day
customer_reviews.author: M. Esslinger

customer_reviews.title: The software on this thing is clumsy. Buy something else, this one is a pain
customer_reviews.text: The software on this thing is clumsy. Does not update properly and overall painful to make work in general. Anything better than this thing
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Miletti

customer_reviews.title: Think before you buy
customer_reviews.text: gets slower every day sometime it will log you out for no reason.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup and use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to work with Xfinity Cable and it worked very easily. Very quick to setup and I was online in around 30 minutes. I live in a two storey townhouse and with the Router on the ground floor I still get a good signal.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work with Comcast
customer_reviews.text: Comcast couldn’t get it to work or just wouldn’t connect on purpose. Sent it right back.
customer_reviews.author: STEVEN J.

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time
customer_reviews.text: Spent 6 hours trying to get it to work with Cox Communications, called both Arris and Cox and they had no idea what the problem was. The Arris was receiving Internet but I couldn't connect to a page no matter what was tried. I returned it and put my old Modem back while I wait for Netgear to try instead. The Arris 3.1 is a complete nightmare, I'll never bye one of these again.
